intro: Isoloma sprucei, commonly known as the Spruce's isoloma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Isoloma sprucei is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
